poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Fluked in a fishtail gown, she flounced Toward the dais through the frowst and crush. Not one to flout her foresight, she Put one foot on the bottom step And found the stitching stopped her. Wasn't that just the glacé fruit To top a fount of Chantilly cream? And would one of those gigolos leave his Champagne flute and help her up?
